manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Welcome module provides a screen with introductory information about using the IDE. The screen appears when you start the IDE for the first time. You can choose basic commands and open help topics directly from this screen.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.autoupdate/1 > 2.16.1, org.openide.awt > 6.2, org.openide.dialogs > 6.5.1, org.openide.filesystems > 6.2, org.openide.loaders, org.openide.modules > 6.5.1, org.openide.nodes > 6.2, org.openide.options > 6.4.1, org.openide.util > 6.2, org.openide.windows > 6.2
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Shows welcome content after the first startup of the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Permits user to create projects representation web module applications. These can be built and deployed to a web server. JSPs and Servlets are supported, as well as web services.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: javax.jmi.reflect/1, org.apache.tools.ant.module/3 > 3.9, org.jdesktop.layout/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.api.debugger/1, org.netbeans.api.debugger.jpda/2, org.netbeans.api.java/1, org.netbeans.api.mdr/1, org.netbeans.api.web.webmodule, org.netbeans.jmi.javamodel/2 > 1.16, org.netbeans.modules.ant.browsetask, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.api.ejbmodule > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.common/1 > 1.7.20, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.dd/1, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.dd.webservice > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.metadata > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.persistenceapi/1 > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/4 > 1.17, org.netbeans.modules.java.platform/1, org.netbeans.modules.java.project/1, org.netbeans.modules.javacore/1, org.netbeans.modules.junit/2, org.netbeans.modules.project.ant/1 > 1.8, org.netbeans.modules.project.libraries/1, org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1, org.netbeans.modules.queries/1, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1, org.netbeans.modules.web.jspparser/2, org.netbeans.modules.websvc.clientapi > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.websvc.jaxwsapi > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.websvc.jaxwsmodel/1 > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.websvc.websvcapi > 1.2, org.openide.actions > 6.2, org.openide.awt > 6.2, org.openide.dialogs > 6.2, org.openide.execution > 1.3, org.openide.filesystems > 6.2, org.openide.loaders, org.openide.modules > 6.2, org.openide.nodes > 6.2, org.openide.options > 6.2, org.openide.util > 6.2, org.openide.windows > 6.2

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Support for Application Client (CAR) Module Projects...

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Enables you to edit, build, compile, and execute C, C++ programs from the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.jdesktop.layout/1 > 1.3.23, org.netbeans.modules.editor/3 > 1.26.1.1, org.netbeans.modules.editor.fold/1 > 1.5.1, org.netbeans.modules.editor.lib/1 > 1.9.1.1, org.netbeans.modules.options.api/0-1 > 1.3.22, org.openide.actions > 6.5.1, org.openide.awt > 6.7.1, org.openide.dialogs > 6.5.1, org.openide.execution > 1.8.1, org.openide.explorer > 6.5.1, org.openide.filesystems > 6.4.1, org.openide.io > 1.9.1, org.openide.loaders > 5.9.1, org.openide.modules > 6.5.1, org.openide.nodes > 6.7.1, org.openide.options > 6.4.1, org.openide.text > 6.9.1, org.openide.util > 6.8.1, org.openide.windows > 6.5.1
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables development of C and C++ programs in the IDE

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Provide support for defining components that embed Swing text editors.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.openide.util > 6.2, org.openide.nodes > 6.2, org.openide.awt > 6.2, org.openide.windows > 6.2, org.openide.dialogs > 6.2, org.openide.options > 6.2
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Generic API wrapping Swing based EditorKits.
